meta.content: Capitol High School in Baton Rouge, Louisiana serves 397 students in grades 9-12. View their 2020 profile to find rankings, test scores, reviews and more.
Capitol High School Profile (2020) | Baton Rouge, LA
Capitol High School in Baton Rouge, Louisiana serves 397 students in grades 9-12. View their 2020 profile to find rankings, test scores, reviews and more.

div.div: x
Navigation
Home > Louisiana > East Baton Rouge Parish
Capitol High School serves 397 students in grades 9-12.

The percentage of students achieving proficiency in Math is ≤20% (which is lower than the Louisiana state average of 63%) for the 2016-17 school year. The percentage of students achieving proficiency in Reading/Language Arts is 20-24% (which is lower than the Louisiana state average of 69%) for the 2016-17 school year.
Capitol High School placed in the bottom 50% of all schools in Louisiana for overall test scores (math proficiency is bottom 50%, and reading proficiency is bottom 50%) for the 2016-17 school year.
The student:teacher ratio of 18:1 is equal to the Louisiana state level of 18:1.

div.p: Capitol High School places among the top 20% of public schools in Louisiana for:

span.a: Largest percent of students eligible for free lunch (Top 20%)

div.div: Capitol High School's student population of 397 students has stayed relatively flat over five school years.
The teacher population of 22 teachers has declined by 42% over five school years.

img.alt: This chart display the students of Capitol High School by grade.
img.title: This chart display the students of Capitol High School by grade.

div.div: Capitol High School is ranked within the bottom 50% of all 1,278 schools in Louisiana (based off of combined Math and Reading proficiency testing data) for the 2016-17 school year.
The school's student:teacher ratio of 18:1 has increased from 11:1 over five school years.
The diversity score of Capitol High School is 0.00, which is less than the diversity score at state average of 0.61. The school's diversity has stayed relatively flat over five school years.

div.div: Source: 2017-2018 (latest school year available) NCES, LA Dept. of Education
The nearest high school to Capitol High School is Madison Preparatory Academy (0.9 miles away)
The nearest middle school is Community School For Apprenticeship Learning (0.9 miles away)
The nearest elementary school is Park Elementary School (0.3 miles away)
